title.narrative: Mise en oeuvre d'une stratégie de communication de l'IRCAAA

description.narrative:
This project will provide funds to develop and implement a communications strategy for the Collaborative Adaptation Research Initiative in Africa and Asia (CARIAA) program that is tailored to the program's cross-regional, collaborative model. It will ensure that research results are shared with key audiences, including researchers, policymakers, media, and development practitioners, to inform adaptation policy and practice.
About CARIAA CARIAA is supporting a network of four consortia to conduct research and policy engagement to help build the poor's resilience in the face of climate change. Two of CARIAA's main objectives are to generate new knowledge on vulnerability and adaptation within climate change hotspots, and to promote uptake of this new knowledge into policy and practice.
Communicating results for change An effective communications strategy is important to link these two objectives, ensuring that research results are tailored and communicated to audiences in line with a clear understanding of their needs, behaviours, and preferences.
CARIAA conducted a review and needs assessment based on its early communications activities, including the program launch process. The result was a set of recommendations for CARIAA's ongoing communications efforts.
Based on the recommendations, this project will build on and complement the consortia's communications and engagement strategies that the program supports. This will include the development of a full communications strategy and implementation plan, and support for related activities, including: -provide communications advisory services -develop a recognizable brand that incorporates CARIAA, the consortia, and institutions it supports to create visibility -offer support to consortia team members on communications and media engagement -develop products that suit different target audience types, including stories demonstrating CARIAA's impact -write, edit, and design communications products -print and translate communications materials
To maintain a coherent approach to achieving the program's objectives, the program will link communications activities to CARIAA's work on knowledge management, synthesis of results, and engagement.
This project will cover activities up to the program's mid-term. At that time, CARIAA will evaluate the effectiveness of the communications strategy and supporting activities.
